name: National Institutes of Health Extramural Loan Repayment Program
objective: To attract and retain health professionals to research careers by offering educational loan repayment for participants who agree by written contract to engage in qualified research in a qualifying nonprofit institution for a minimum of two years. There are six subcategories of research: contraception or infertility research, pediatric research, minority health disparities research, clinical research, clinical research for individuals from disadvantaged backgrounds, and research in emerging areas critical to human health.
top_agency_name: Department of Health and Human Services
beneficiary_types: Specialized group (e.g. health professionals, students, veterans)
applicant_types: Specialized group (e.g. health professionals, students, veterans)

authorizations.text: II, C, 2022, 21st Century Cures Act. Pub. L. 114, 255. 42 U.S.C. § 288-2.

rules_regulations: Pertinent information is contained in 21st Century Cures Act, Title II, Subtitle C, Section 2022, Public Law 114-255, 42 USC 288-2. The NIH Extramural LRP was initially announced by publication of a Notice in the Federal Register (Vol. 66, No. 173), and updated in Federal Register (Vol. 68, No. 61).
